Explain how water moves from the soil to the leaves of a plant, using the terms cohesion, adhesion and transpiration pull.
answer: transpiration in the leaves creates a tension (transpiration pull) that draws water up the xylem; cohesion between water molecules and adhesion to xylem walls maintain a continuous column of water from roots to leaves
water is lost from leaves by transpiration, which creates negative pressure; cohesion and adhesion allow the water column to be pulled up through the xylem from the soil
